BiblioData.Title: HIGH HARMONICS GENERATION OF LIGHT
BiblioData.Abstract: A method of generating light is disclosed. The method comprises irradiating a substance (12) with first optical field (16) of a first frequency and second optical field (20) of a second frequency. The second frequency being higher than a cutoff frequency of a harmonics generation HGS spectrum characterizing the interaction of the substance (12) with the first optical field (16). Furthermore, an apparatus (10) comprises the substance (12), a first light source (14) for generating the first optical field (16) and a second light source (18)- for generating the second optical field (20).

Claims.P: 1. A method of generating light, comprising irradiating a substance with first optical field of a first frequency and second optical field of a second frequency, said second frequency being higher than a cutoff frequency of a harmonics generation spectrum characterizing the interaction of said substance with said first optical field.

2. Apparatus for generating light, comprising a substance, a first light source for generating in the direction of said substance first optical field of a first frequency and a second light source for generating in the direction of said substance second optical field of a second frequency, said second frequency being higher than a cutoff frequency of a harmonics generation spectrum characterizing the interaction of said substance with said first optical field.

3. An imaging system for imaging an object or a scene, comprising the apparatus of claim 2 arranged to direct light to the object or scene, and an imager configured for imaging the object or scene based on light emitted thereby, reflected therefrom or transmitted therethrough.

4. A spectroscopy system for determining the concentration of analyte in a sample, comprising the apparatus of claim 2 arranged to direct light to the sample, and a light detector configured for detecting light emitted by, reflected from or transmitted through the sample.

5. A lithography system, comprising the apparatus of claim 2 arranged to direct a light beam to a substrate to form patterns thereon, and alignment mechanism for aligning said substrate with said light beam.
6. A micro-machining system, comprising the apparatus of claim 2.
7. The method, apparatus or system of claim 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 or 6, wherein said first frequency is in the infrared range.
8. The method, apparatus or system of claim 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 or 6, wherein said second frequency is in the ultraviolet range.
9. The method, apparatus or system of claim 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 or 6, wherein said second frequency is in the extreme ultraviolet range.
10. The method, apparatus or system of claim 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 or 6, wherein said second frequency is in the X-ray range.
11. The method, apparatus or system of claim 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 or 6, wherein the ratio between said second frequency and said first frequency is an integer.
12. The method, apparatus or system of claim 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 or 6, wherein the ratio between said second frequency and said first frequency is non-integer.
13. The method, apparatus or system of claim 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 or 6, wherein said first optical field has an intensity which is substantially higher than the intensity of said second optical field.
14. The method, apparatus or system of claim 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 or 6, wherein said first optical field has an intensity which approximately equals the intensity of said second optical field.
15. The method, apparatus or system of claim 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 or 6, wherein said first optical field has an intensity which is lower than the intensity of said second optical field.

16. The method, apparatus or system of claim 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 or 6, wherein a combination of said first optical field and said second optical field results in emission of a harmonics generation spectrum from said substance, said emitted harmonics generation spectrum having at least one harmonic which is enhanced relative to a respective harmonic of the harmonics generation spectrum that would have been emitted had said substance been irradiated solely by said first optical field.
